reviews.review_msg: This was my first class in college in 5 years and my first English course in nearly 10 years. I enjoyed most of the book selections and found Nathan to be a great professor. The lectures were okay, the assignments were good and the grading was fair. I didn't care for the weekly in-class on the spot writing, but it is a W course. Loved the project.

Broc is a great lecturer and I highly recommend taking a class with him. His reading list was amazing and I loved all the books. He has a funny and outgoing personality that makes the lecture so enjoyable. My favourite English professor so far!

Broc was very interesting and engaging. I only took this class for the W requirement and thought it would be a grind since I've never liked English but I genuinely enjoyed this class. Study the big themes talked about in class and you will be good for the final.

AMAZING PROFESSOR. I typically don't like English, however, Broc made me look foward to every lecture. He keeps the students engaged, and he genuinely cares about his students, and humanity in general! He is also can start a class making the entire class burst into laughter over a semi-inapppropriate comment, and end it in deep thought.

Even with a mic, you cannot hear her. She speaks incredibly softly for some reason. Her lectures are super boring. The content is not interesting at all. Her reading list is terrible. All of the books are so boring and not engaging. Your grade is dependent on your TA. My TA was terrible; she spoke with a thick accent!

Her reading list was extremely boring and not engaging or interesting at all. She also talks extremely quietly during lecture (even though she's wearing a mic) so you can only hear half the things she says. She's sweet, nice, and a good teacher, but I didn't really enjoy the material or information taught in her class.

I personally found her lectures fairly interesting, she's very kind and attempts to make people laugh with small jokes which is cute. However, a few of the novels were very boring. The final is very fair if you take notes during lectures and read through them.
Nice enough professor, but overall lectures were extremely boring and subjective.

Took this class in 2020. She would only do lectures with the students every 3 weeks, which was unfortunate since our books would be done by then. There were 4 books, 3 of them were interesting one was so complex boring. I got away with only reading 2/4 books and getting a good grade, that's English for you lol. TAs were the highlight of the class!
Nicky is a chill prof who makes the class engaging. The creative project is fun, and she preps you well for the exam. I found unstuck study super helpful for study prep too.

I took ENGL113W and loved it. Nicky is an excellent professor; very laid-back and clearly cares for her students. The texts are not very difficult and the creative project is great for anyone who likes theatre/scriptwriting. She prepares the class well for the exam, just pay attention and it'll be smooth sailing.

Nicky fosters discussion quite well. I normally never participate in class discussion, but I really felt inclined to with Nicky. All of her assignments were engaging and had many options to be as applicable as possible to the student. The late penalty was pretty lax, with only a 1% deduction per day late. Overall cool prof, if you like English.

As an intended English major, this class made me change my mind. It is extremely uncommon that the lecture itself is useful. The texts are interesting enough, and the content is alright, but the lectures are literally Nicky talking for 10 mins and the rest is opinions from peers which suck. She seems nice but save yourself the despair.

Dr. Colligan provided very insightful lectures revolving around The New Yorker podcasts. The class was very straightforward, not course work heavy, having only a few journals and essays to complete. The tutorials were led by separate TAs and work was graded by them instead of Dr. Colligan. Feedback was dependent on the TA.

Extremely disappointed in the marking done in this class. After my first journal entries, I decided to get help from the Prof to improve my next entry as well as improve my essay. I ended up getting significantly lower marks. I wouldnt recommend that anyone take an English course just because of how subjective the marking in the class can be.

Theres no way to get a good grade in this class. All the journals and essay markings are subjective and depend on what the TAs think is good. Theres no concrete way of getting a good mark and there is little effort put into helping the students improve their essays. Instead, we are provided with vague comments on why we didnt get full marks,
Tutorial matters, but overall an interesting and easy class.

Take a different English course.  Nicky is extremely condescending and haughty whilst somehow incapable of successfully completing her lectures on time, and then gets upset at people for wanting to leave at the designated time rather than waiting for her to finish (which almost never contains anything important).

Description of ENGL112W is very misleading: says we will read a wide array of modern lit, but we are only reading about video games - had I known this, I would not have picked this clsss!
She is so smug:she  literally explained what ‘compare' and ‘contrast' means in a very demeaning way: we are university students, we know what those words mean.

Class is only 1 hour, but she wastes the first 15 minutes of our 60 minute class unnecessarily explaining updates for ALL SFU students (such as how to sit in a chair and how to book a study room) and doing a body prayer (I'm serious). In a 60 minute class, there simply is NOT ENOUGH TIME to discuss unnecessary things completely unrelated to English

I have never had a more smug and condescending professor. She wastes the first quarter of every class on "prayer" but then leaves no time to finish the lecture and gets upset when students leave at class end. She is uncomfortably obsessed with politics. The lecture is useless & can be easily skipped w/o consequence. Easy tho

Take any other english class for your own sanity. Nicky is one of the most difficult prof's i've ever had. If she doesn't like your writing based on her own personal beliefs you will not succeed. And she will tear everything about it apart. The way she carries herself is very condisending and she thinks she is above all.

Wacky! Said in the first class that she was 'female but not feminine' and 'a-romantic' - don't know how that relates to English, don't know why she thought we as students, would care? All we are reading about is science fiction and video games - subjects I know nothing about. Had I known this while selecting courses, I would have chosen otherwise!!

She may be good at what she does but she cannot really impart anything. She is not a “teacher”. On occasion you get the impression that she has something to prove. It is not about the student.
It is about her.

Nicky is one of the best profs I've had but the content can be a bit dense since she manages to pack so much is such a small time. The papers were the hardest part of the course but Nicky does a great job of teaching and having fun at the same time.

I found her choice of readings interesting (graphic novels + video game related content) - the reason why I chose her. Her lectures were kinda boring, but tutorials were definitely helpful for writing papers and for the final exam prep. Get to know your TA as they do most of the marking, and always ask for feedback. Overall, Nicky is a sweet prof.

I found her lectures so boring. Over the whole semester you are only graded on one essay a reflection and the final so if you mess up an asiigment there not alot of time to get ur mark back up she also said the n-word in lecture as she said she was jus "quoting the text". overall she seems kinda of nice but this class was not for me
Nicky was an amazing prof because her grading criteria was always very clear and her lectures were also done very well. Overall, I would highly recommend taking an English course with her !

Real talk Collis is a great prof and very kind overall, however the TA'S make or break your grade in this class. The assignments and papers aren't completely easy but also not too difficult as long as you put time and effort into them. Also, don't worry if you aren't a good writer, this class will help you.

Rawia was an ineffective facilitator. Assignments took a LONG time to be marked, even when there was a 2nd part to the assignment (rewrites/outlines). This meant that assignments were delayed by at least 2 weeks. Only 1 essay had grading criteria, the rest did not, so you had no idea what you were marked on. Did not release marks for final either.

The prof & the TA I had for this class really helped me improve my writing style. My first essay gave me a C- in the course; I went into office hours to get advice on what I could have done better. My TA was a big help for that, but immediately in lecture the prof covered common problems that everyone had in the essay. Final was based on lectures.
He is awesome!!! Take his class!!
